skill.name: main-orchestrator
skill.description: Decomposes requirements into executable tasks and coordinates domain orchestrators (frontend, backend, data, test, devops). Use when receiving PRDs, user requirements, or feature requests that span multiple domains. Acts as CEO of the AI development system.
skill.summary: Decomposes requirements into executable tasks and coordinates domain orchestrators (frontend, backen...
skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and workflow templates. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access detected. This is a meta-skill for coordinating other AI skills.

content.value_statement: Complex software projects require careful planning across frontend, backend, and data teams. This skill breaks down requirements into actionable tasks and coordinates domain-specific orchestrators to ensure quality standards are met.
actual_capabilities: Decompose product requirements into structured task definitions
Create epic-level plans with dependencies and priority assignment
Route tasks to domain orchestrators (frontend, backend, data, test, devops)
Define quality gates and test requirements for each task
Resolve cross-domain conflicts and manage task dependencies
Track progress and trigger documentation on epic completion
limitations: Does not execute code or perform actual development tasks
Does not generate production-ready code directly
Does not modify files on the filesystem
Does not integrate with external tools or APIs

use_cases.title: Coordinate complex features
use_cases.description: Break down multi-domain features into tasks and assign to appropriate domain orchestrators

use_cases.title: Convert PRDs to tasks
use_cases.description: Transform product requirements documents into actionable development tasks with clear success criteria

use_cases.title: Manage epic progress
use_cases.description: Track large initiatives across frontend, backend, and data domains with dependency resolution

prompt_templates.title: Basic Feature Request
prompt_templates.scenario: Convert a feature idea into tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Break down this feature into tasks: [describe your feature requirement]

prompt_templates.title: PRD Processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this PRD and create a task decomposition: [paste your PRD content]

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Domain Feature
prompt_templates.scenario: Plan a complex feature with dependencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an epic plan for this feature that spans [frontend/backend/data] with dependencies: [describe feature]

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this requirement and document the architectural decisions with pros and cons: [describe requirement]

output_examples.input: Add a user notification system with email and push notifications
output: Tasks defined: 5 tasks across frontend, backend, and data domains
Dependencies mapped: backend tasks must complete before frontend integration
Quality gates: 8 test types specified per task

best_practices: Provide detailed requirements with acceptance criteria for accurate task decomposition
Identify cross-domain dependencies early to prevent blockers later in development
Keep tasks small and focused (under 100 lines of code equivalent) for better quality control
anti_patterns: Creating mega-tasks that span multiple domains without decomposition
Skipping test requirements to save time during implementation
Bypassing domain orchestrators with direct skill invocation

faq.question: Which AI tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on all supported platforms.

faq.question: How large can epics be?
faq.answer: Epics can range from single features to entire product launches. The skill handles any scale.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with external project management tools?
faq.answer: No, this skill operates within the AI state management system for orchestration only.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, all data stays within the AI state system. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are tasks not being assigned correctly?
faq.answer: Ensure requirements clearly specify which domains (frontend, backend, data) are affected.

faq.question: How is this different from general project management tools?
faq.answer: This skill understands AI development workflows, integrates with domain orchestrators, and enforces quality standards specific to software development.
